NvDw2awqbz3nGNyVjIEkBg.text: The food here is abysmal. Had the Sofrito bowl with no rice & beans & praise the lord I didn't go that far!   The pork was old as George Washington's teeth & just as wooden. The veggies were limp & lacked any taste.  Even adding salt did no justice. Still hungry I ordered fries. Dummy decision for sure. If I hated the first dish why order something so simple as fries? Hard as rocks with even less edifice to eat. For AP prices, CLT STEP YA GAME UP! Drinks are ok because that's the focus right? But a specialty drink in a half size cup for full size prices.  Do Better! Service was spotty but the folks nice.

76pHhh-UGSbfec3i8qDCTQ.text: The customer service was great! The food not so much but it was hot fresh and edible. The  jerk burger was juicy but where was the jerk! The fries taste like McDonald's except bland so pass the st on over. The Bacardi mojito was good but not great it lacked the main ingredient.... Bacardi ...i honestly thought it was Virgin.  This place could have used a mop and rag. I sat on a dirty table .... so let's see two jerk burgers at 13.99 a piece and mojitos at $15 a piece. A bit overpriced but that's the airport for you. The guy who served us was really nice though. He earned his tip. Probably won't be back unless they make a real mojito lol

I6H63PeDlWbyN0OXPRXmZQ.text: Seriously bad food! Bacardi Bowl was inedible and the guac was mega market purchased and horrible!

Nx0XN_DPcNQPw1Ou5NXXoQ.text: For airport food this was pretty good.  I had a bowl of some sort which was pretty tasty and my mother enjoyed her lettuce wraps.  The prices are outrageous for what you get but you're at an airport and that's just part of the cost of traveling.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

62Nu5oXOVdHdrtB_BerIpA.text: I came here because I frequent a Cuban restaurant at home which has a fantastic rum selection. This place has Bacardi. That's it. 3 or 4 varieties of Bacardi, but only Bacardi - speaking of rum.  Clearly I was expecting too much of a place called "Rum Bar." They also have other spirits and draft beer although 2 of the 4 taps had cups over the handles likely indicating they were empty.   The food: I ordered the Cuban sandwich with "rum bar" fries. The sandwich was small and was served just warm enough to begin melting the Swiss cheese inside. The roll was toasted enough however to make it too hard in a few places.  I left those bread chunks on the plate. The fries were nothing special, not sure why they give them a name. Plain fries served cold and limp. The fries were left on the plate along side the hard bread chunks.  I ate the sandwich because I was hungry - hadn't eaten all day and likely wouldn't for another 5 or 6 hours. The service: I sat at the bar.  The bartender lacked any personality.  He placed my club soda in front of me without a word.   5 or 6 minutes after I ordered the sandwich, he came back and asked "What did you want me to put in for you?" When he delivered the sandwich, again not a word. He did give me a nearly empty ketchup bottle.  Fortunately there was one next to me from the previous patron. Not once did he come over to ask about the food or if I wanted a refill on the empty club soda.  As I sat there eating the sandwich, I noticed a row of dirty empty glasses lined up in front of me.   I guess you can get away with bad food and poor service if you don't have to count on returning customer in the airport.

ybFZB2-6llpzhEF9-yxx7A.text: I've eaten inside of plenty of airports, and often find some great food! This, however, was a meh experience to my tastebuds. Glad I had a blue moon to wash it all down lol But seriously, the menu states that you get seasoned fries or rice and beans with your sandwich or tacos, and I chose the seasoned fries which lacked 0 ounces of flavor and maybe 2 speckles of seasoning. Grateful for Heinz Ketchup!   Best part of this outing was Rayshaad (waiter)! He was great! Provided prompt service and wanted to assure that I didn't need anything else.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

0ra4jDVDZCe5KtWXGMwdvg.text: Located in terminal D, but I don't recall which gate it was near, so you're on your own for that folks.  It's not a bad place to eat and chill out for a brewski as you await your flight.  But, yes, this one is also managed by the Aramark of airports, HMSHost, so it's going to be pricey, the food not too bad, and the service not the best in the world.  The food is Jamaican and Caribbean themed for the most part, and of course they have Bacardi rum since it has the Bacardi brand name on the joint.    I had the Mojo Veggie Bowl with guacamole, grilled veggies and a vinaigrette dressing - $11.99.  Not the best food in the world, but it was a decent portion size.  They also have Grilled Mojo Veggie Tacos if veggies are your thing - those are $9.99 but I didn't have them.  They have plenty of TVs with all the games on.  The staff are friendly but very busy, so you should probably sit at the bar if you want to be served.  Table service was sparse.  They have a full bar, 8 beers on tap, and 16 beers in bottles or cans.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu - in case they don&#39;t give you one.  It was like pulling teeth for me to get one.
Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brewski list

md60BcOvhabo8VvkjZD-SA.text: Absolutely horrible food. I went there while in terminal D in Charlotte airport so I could eat at a sit down restaurant. They only thing good about the place was the music and the sever. I got nachos. The chips were so soggy they were mush and bent in half with our breaking. The cheddar cheese was clearly microwaved in and hardened. The black beans were so heavy and excessive. And the chicken was clearly not cooked fresh. More like all microwaved. It was awful. I ate a few bites and was done. Never will I ever stop back at this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nachos. Disgusting

2j3EiIQQK0oH6gUlnMoYHg.text: Well this place was a huge disappointment. Today, it wasn't crowded so I decided to come in.  I ordered the crunchy chicken taco and it was overly cooked to achieve the crunchiness I guess... it was flavorless, the taco was cold, the whole thing was cold. The fries was eh. I am glad I tried it so I know not to come back. Maybe the drinks are better but I didn't try that.  Service was ok.  Don't eat here. Get some sushi across the way, some Chic Fil a or something else or wait til you get home. It's not worth it.  I might have to get some candy to overcome this taste. Can't wait to go to my hotel and brush my teeth.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

o0cldTgONpd75qhRjZqWVQ.text: Once again I'm at Charlotte Douglas Airport waiting for my delayed American Airline flight to board.  I've got time on my side so I checked out some of the eats in terminal D! Rum Bar & Grill caught my eye and my nostrils so I'm waiting to order.  The patrons look happy eating here and the food from what I can see looks yummy.  Nice selections on the menu and the burgers are right up my alley; cooked to order and piping hot!   10 minutes later and it figures, my food is about to come out and we're boarding now so I have to take my food on the run!

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

JofhvaqNHE2nuZLgP46UwQ.text: Undecided about two options (sandwich Cubano or burger), ended up having the Rum burger because they had no Cubano!! Well, it was my luck.  When food showed up, it was not hot like if it was just cooked. Weird...however I decided to eat it as it was, I mean, it was not cold either. Fries were like the ones you get in McDonalds...as soon as they get cold, they get hard or with no taste. The burger was well prepared and tasty.  The soda was not properly carbonated. Go figure...maybe it was me. Service was good and I liked the pods they have for you to call your server when you need it.  Average place...the only reason I chose it (in spite of the 2.5 stars) was because it was in front of my gate and (very convenient) chargers in the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rum burger

pUUdFgRdxGv3csvuWYjl7w.text: Wow, a more premium food offering with absolutely terrible quality. Ordered 2 Mojo Veggie bowls and was shocked at how little and basic the offering was. Just some rice, beans and a few veggies with the worst guacamole I've ever had. Not to mention of of the bowls had a large piece of charred something? in it which hurt my teeth when I bit down on it. There really is very little attention to quality and portion size here. Absolutely would not recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Found this lovely piece of charred something? in my meal. It nearly broke my tooth when biting down on it.

fLbAwDB-02ydmCe0bhpzSQ.text: Got Mahi fish tocos $14.99 the fish was cold. The flour tortillas were cold as if taken right out of the bag and served. Never warmed up. The server had a attitude. Being the fish is cold and dry the fish is old. The only thing good was the rice and beans.

yIyJYcI0HItp-pWZ_aOvHw.text: Well if you like your restaurant dirty and out of food with minimal service, this is your place. We watched as the waiter coughed all over the food as he picked it up and then serve it. Conserve your drink because it takes time for them to refill. They were out of most of the simple food (chicken, salsa, pickles etc.) Do your self a favor and.keep walking!

jw_7IF8O8R3ksTJtgj64Ig.text: I had one of the worst customer service experiences of my life in this establishment. Amy poured drinks all over my girls and from that point forward proceeded to act stank! We were delayed by four hours and just wanted to drink and move forward; however, after the drink was splashed on my girls she continued with her poor attitude. I finally tried to intervene and say we just want to have fun and move on and she called us "hostile". I was done from that point and could not enjoy myself. For that reason, I give them a negative review. She could have recovered with a positive attitude but she didn't. The food was okay too. The manger did come and was positive but unfortunately Amy continued with her poor attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

hp814ePBCMErGnOFVOfkLw.text: I mean you're in an airport with limited options so this is sufficient, I suppose.  It is very loud and kind of chaotic. If you're traveling with children and are in terminal D...go elsewhere. The Cuban sandwich was very hard and inedible. My BF got the Mahi mahi tacos - yelp showed that the meal comes with three tacos but he got two. The tacos were no bueno

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

Xn5J2uuIsAzqcbI8oWhPVA.text: I have been here a few times (usually to kill time), and to be honest, it is just typical airport food. Nothing really great, but just average at best. I would agree with other reviews, the music here is definitely too loud. The food is a bit overpriced, however, the drinks are WAY overpriced - even for an airport it seems!   They do however have a GREAT view outside, so that is a plus!

gv0zhKEVBSQ4sbItdhJi8A.text: I wish i could give this place zero stars!!! we waited 20 mins for a cuban and burger and not to mention half of the stuff that they said would be on it wasn't. $50 for a long wait and bad food. Our food wasn't even prepared properly. Do not waste your time here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. terrible portions and this cuban was $13!!! Are you kidding???

bh0fRO310v3sPm9lGj26sw.text: I had a layover that day and  decided to eat here for breakfast. You get to sit wherever you want and the server will come to you. The service was great, the food came out fast. Here's the bad part though, the food was pretty bad. For something that will cost you $10-$13, I expected better. If anyone is reading my review, I'd recommend you go somewhere else to eat. Trust me on this one!

XlWYYl2vwtj2A661frnIQQ.text: So you're at the airport and obviously there's limited options. If I were you I'd skip this place and find something else.   Food: Food was very average to below average. Fries were stale. Chicken tacos ehh, jerk burger was ok. Also it's way overpriced but hey you're stuck.   Service/decor: Average at best here too. Find somewhere else honestly.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

-Ee-GbyJvH2_T5b3YdNgIQ.text: I was excited to see a healthy veggie option instead of fast and fried food. I ordered and waited about 10 minutes and got a sloppy mess of soft rice, watery beans, summer squash slices, and one piece of broccoli. A scoop of flavorless quac to the side was an added bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mojo veggie bowl takeout looks like a summer squash hot mess. Skip it at $11.99

34QhtowT44q80eR8xv2-xg.text: Pathetic everything from the word go. Rude staff, poor service, and overpriced food and beverage. HMS should turn over management and staff with some people that have at least basic service and hospitality skills.

0GCdSxIle_ku7cGKhcIy7w.text: This place got the job done! I was actually surprise how good our food was... we were looking for anything that wasn't fried and no burgers or sandwiches (we ate so much po' boys in NOLA we needed a break). Rum bar has rice bowls on the menu so we tired it and tore it up! Also I like that we seated ourselves and rang for a server. You get in get out and eat good, what more can you ask for?

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp bowl
Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk chicken bowl

bK2Fy2lGudCLmLKcMtBF6w.text: On a layover to France at the Charlotte airport, and I couldn't resist the hip, inviting decore.  I was convinced to get a a $3 double rum and coke, and I ordered the chicken fingers and chips.  The drink was absolutely weak (double? No free pour here!).  The chicken was good, but $10 was a bit too steep e en for airport food.  I would advise sticking to shots.

lrMRJ-HbckaDbYIcOdPS6A.text: This place was conveniently located right near our gate at the airport.  This is a bacardi-themed restaurant that serves up some quick takes on Cuban cuisine.  Since I had to run, I ordered a Cuban sandwich and a bloody mary.  They offered a double shot for just $3 more so I took them up on their offer.  The food took a little while to come out and was ok.  I think they nuked the sandwich though because by the time I got to the end, the bread was hard as a rock.  Not bad, overall.

gBN5Pz7OF0mshGaPgK9TSQ.text: The Mojitos were decent, but the bar food left much to be desired. It's a nice spot to wait for your flight, but you won't be impressed by the food even when considering the low airport standards.

bzTZX1ISSbgj0lwbA3jrcA.text: Coconut Mango Wings are great! I was traveling for work so I couldn't try a mojito but they looked like the real deal!!!!

rrVa9dW7z2HUKLTXOqkwLg.text: It's bright, there is wine, I'm waiting for my plane to Rhody, it will do. The bartender is not the friendliest, barely a smile from either of them, but I do like meeting new people, people that are traveling. So that's cool. I'm going to get off my phone and start being social.

_mOaGeRgK55_CsuX77Dwdw.text: Had a layover in Charlotte, and decided to try this spot.  It was late and I was hungry, and they were closest to our gate. We didn't expect much, but boy were we in for a suprise.  I don't know how Cuban it is, but I had the chicken mojito, which was delicious!  I don't eat black beans, but I cleaned my plate.  The drinks were just okay.  We got something the waitress suggested, but I'd try something else next time.  I wish we had one of these close to home, because I would be there every week.

SjKC2DHvLwyC_Iszw4ZH3Q.text: Well cooked black beans were a surprise. We like black beans, but many restaurants under-cook them. I had the chicken mojito, prepared fresh, and it was well spiced and excellent, an under-used phrase at airports. My wife had the Cuban sandwich which was very good.

yT4I92V_WJdRNDaO-IJKMA.text: Rum Bar is a Bacardi restaurant concept licensed in this case by FHM. I had a Cuban sandwich on 2/9 while waiting for my flight to BOS. I didn't expect much, but the sandwich I got was great. At $10.49 it was a value considering that wet, 2-day-old ham and cheese subs at airport newstands can cost $8. The ham was smokey and not overly sweet. The roast pork was moist and rich. The bread was crunchy outside, chewy inside, and authentic. I'm accustomed to sandwich Cubanos with Swiss cheese. This had what I'm fairly sure was Fontina, but it worked. The menu was extensive and included a wide variety of entrees, such as a marinated flank steak,  and salads; all well-priced. The decor' was hip. It had a nighclub feel. Rum Bar has some great cocktails, too. Oddly, drink prices aren't printed on the menu. This was a warning sign. I was on a potential employer's expense account and didn't want to spend $15 on a cocktail. Anyway, if you're at CLT and hungry, I highly recommend Rum Bar.

1mxL5alzsm3PmP6CB8RZRA.text: Service is okay and food is below average and pricey. Shrimp bowl had very small shrimp and drink came out slowly and incorrectly, server made up for it by bringing the correct item (for free) which was nice. Overall drinks were 7/10 but food was 2/10. However, it took 15+ minutes after I was done eating to bring the bill. Try other choices when at CLT.

BgXvFymblHs4BFoULQvLfw.text: Perhaps a good place for a drink, but the food was positively dreadful even by airport food standards. Split chicken fingers and fries with my son. Food was dry and bland. I found the server to be borderline rude despite the place being empty. Prices were really high although you have to expect that at an airport. Wish I would have walked a little further to a more local establishment.

Ifs0nbJi1o9a2e3XfesIbw.text: Excellent pallamillo steak salad with local beer. Stick at Clt we spent a lovely two hours here  Best at the airport.

gXtADTCK1i94t-jx9u1YPg.text: Service was indifferent. I got chicken tenders, which were anything but tender.   I asked for an extra barbecue sauce. By the time I was delivered the sauce, I was almost done eating. One of the three chicken tenders, one was good but the other two were burnt.   The beer on tap was good. That's the only redeeming quality of this place , which time I will specifically avoid the next time I am in this airport.

4cNevo02wg8Do2u9sWqFrA.text: Solid service. Mediocre fare. Incessant steel drums. The nachos were typical but still appetizing. We each got a salad which came out to be disappointing but still edible.   The sweet tea is really sweet.

GMS7UN-YDGVAC1SOxnPoow.text: Service was great my man was under staffed and still was extremely helpful in his service. Was prompt and the altitude project bottle came to us cold! Great stop off.

_qyD1i_KHzMNu_3Ci-1r4w.text: Drinks were lame even with extra pour. Burger came out on a McDonald's bun and chicken tacos tasted like they were in the fryer 10mins too long. Bartender was nice and it was in my terminal.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Full bar

n66SE3mF6QuHu8w7Xq6B2w.text: Small drinks, stale nachos, little flies.    There must be a better place.  I wish I checked yelp before I sat down.  Stay away  I will say that the service and bartender was fine.

y6yIay2vZOTboc5lktoOLw.text: Very expensive for an airport restaurant. I got the honey shrimp bowl. Delicious food. Still not worth the money. Prices weren't listed.

0MtwGQlpCVw3y7r-n6OerA.text: The food was tasty but scant!!! I got the omelet that came with breakfast potatoes. I promise you there were literally 5 pieces of potatoes (slightly smaller than steak fries). Good thing I'm on weight watchers because I would've made a fuss. My travel buddies got an order of pineapple pancakes. 3 pancakes came with 3 strips of bacon. The bottom pancake was the only one that contained pieces of pineapple. Overall the pancakes are nothing to shout about.

NKdWyYqnLy1XhFxbSqJFYQ.text: I hit these guys the day after the worst snow storm in a decade to come through Charlotte. The staff had spent the previous night at the airport and was exhausted. I got the nachos, which were terrible. However, my waitress got it taken off my bill without me even asking for it.  The wait staff was amazing! Will definitely go there again even if it's in a concourse I hardly ever visit.

o-fEbybSDMAnuDYpXEhVsQ.text: Pomegranate martini while waiting for my flight? Yes please. And nothing on the menu I can eat? Whatevs, I'll snack on some super unhealthy fries.  The server I had was pretty cool. Definitely an accommodating dude. Despite the bustling people outside of the dining area, I was able to actually kick back for an hour and read/people watch.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delayed Flight Dinner of Champions

5udSH-hoDKlHiSmke17FMg.text: By far one of the worst, most overrated and overpriced eateries in the entire airport. The food was bad, soup was cold and our frumpy waitress had a very bad attitude. Do yourself a favor and go to Bad Daddys on concourse C.

otN-WG1A1UEM_wZPEemLxA.text: Pretty good for an airport restaurant! It's owned by his host, which is a good and bad thing. Seems like pretty decent quality control, but the food was pretty bland, definitely from a chain. If you are stuck having to eat in an airport it's on the better end! I had the jerk burger and my wife had the Cobb salad. The burger was cooked pretty well

UdPcsnosyuIkEjMrOSWr1A.text: Food was actually pretty good for airport food :) Had the jerk chicken bowl and it tasted good. The price seems a bit high for the amount of food that you get but that is probably due to being located at an airport.

PpDW6pQoVEfVQB7-rcyX8Q.text: It is a fun and welcoming place, but the food was disappointing. My burger was not at all as I asked, and dripped in grease. There was a puddle on my plate before I was even half-way through. That would have all been fine (I was really hungry and went ahead and ate anyway), but the meat itself had no taste. I wish I had checked the reviews before. Still, I give it two stars because the waiter was efficient

zebpNApql_N81_HshoXJNA.text: I ordered the food for pick up and decided to eat. As soon as I sat the waiter came to me and told me that I could sit but take out sit across the restaurant. So Fing insulting to mention that to a customer,  when  most of the tables were empty anyway. I would never to there again with the staff so insulting. Manager seems nice after I spoke to him but didn't seem that he even spoke to her(waiter). I don't know why they don't teach them before putting them to serve people

sZ_xnjbhVgFqQ7X8c-9heA.text: Would have given 1 but service was good. Boxed burger that was supposed to have Avocado on it but had a smattering of green guar gum based avocado goo. Menu is dishonest so buyer beware. Burger cool....Bun dried out but fries hot. Humph.

OQK31wGI_ge0irjWERR7Tg.text: Mediocre rum burger, not awesome fries and flat soda pop...the wait staff was on island time...slow but friendly. One redeeming factor is the waiter gave is a to go soda.

F3Or9lsgZAOpRw6OdlIpRw.text: We really liked the waiter, fast and very friendly. However, we ordered their specialty rum bowl with rice and beans. Guess what? Out of rice!! No joke!!

lHPfEqK4if-2x8lB4DE53A.text: The original Rum Bar located in Charlotte international airport was a pleasant stop for dinner in between flights. We shared the Cubano sandwich and the crispy chicken tacos. Both were slightly above average, and served quick. Decent selection of beers and liqueurs to choose from. Waiting staff was courteous enough. May come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

_9Xdgnhm8ROw1HGW42gHPA.text: This place was busy and looked like it had possibilities.  They really tout their Bacardi Rum lineage too.  My spouse and ordered different Rum Bowls. I had the sofrito pork bowl and she had the jerk chicken.  I also added the optional fried egg on top of mine.  Both came with beans and rice.  The portions are certainly generous.  That's where the good news ends though.  Both dishes had a sauce base of a thick, bland flavorless tomato sauce.  It was like something straight out of a can.  I added tons of hot sauce to no avail.   No heat, spice or flavor to be found in both.  To add insult to injury, the egg was fried hard and burnt.  The server was also MIA.  Take my advice, fly on by....

RxkQvCfsxyN65c6LQProRw.text: Rude staff. Food - underwhelming at best.  They were out of corn tortillas. I found this out after I had ordered and forgot to specify corn. I went over to correct my order and was told they were out which is why I was not given a choice. Would have liked to know this before I ordered...I asked for them to leave out the tortillas and received the most pathetic looking piece of fish in the world - small and flavorless. My drink was slammed down on my table with no eye contact from the server, and now I am waiting way too long for my bill.  Update: they gave me a 10% discount,  still 2 stars though,  but I appreciate the gesture.

FsfAdBwkdMtUk9e1n4vNoA.text: We had a delayed flight on US Airways (surprise right??) and we decided to stop in here for a meal.  There are no outlets, so don't even ask. Our server was very nice and attentive, but I came here for the food. Ugh, I guess I shouldn't have expected much because it is in an airport. The chicken tenders I got were so heavily coated and fried that I couldn't even taste chicken. I ate a little because I was hungry but I just couldn't continue. I knew I was ordering chicken strips, but wow, they were pretty darn bad.  Also, there is a lot of natural light in here because of the windows, but that also makes it warmer that is really comfortable.   If I am stuck in this airport again, I'll walk a little further and look for some different food that maybe has a little taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy chicken strips
Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cuban sandwich

lz2feDDOH6Pt4ehNYT9Ezg.text: This is for the Rum Bar Express. The staff are unprofessional and unorganized. They forgot my order and the order for the woman behind me. Took about 20 minutes to get my shrimp bowl. The lady behind me asked for a refund bc she couldn't wait longer. They spent more time chatting with other airport employees than taking/making orders. The kitchen staff looked like they were diligent. Cashiers, definitely need more training. Don't recommend if you are in a rush.

Lb3zMN5z0oxDxs6i-QE65A.text: I travel a lot for work. This morning was the 3rd time I've sat at this place for 20-30+ minutes, pushed the prompt service button, and no one ever came, again. If you have a bit, take yourself to another place in a different concourse.

k1JtAgUTI4fjnC4dKp8j4Q.text: Came here on the way to Philly Airport. Was excited to eat my food until I sat down and was told because I ordered from the takeout part of the Resturant that I could not sit in the Resturant part of the Resturant. I spoke to the manager and he says they are not supposed to do that and he would talk to her. I won't be returning . I hate poor customer service . I REFUSE TO ACCEPT IT and spend money at the same place.   Even if the food turns out to be the best that I've had , I won't be returning .

2JJ_EMWHq41RIeSWSysQMA.text: Absolutely aweful!  I wanted a hot, full meal without having to walk a mile to the next terminal.  I ordered the jerk chicken sandwich with rice and beans.  The chicken was not jerk, just plain ole grilled chicken.  The meal was supposed to be cooked to order but it was luke warm.  The bread for the sanwich had the rubbery texture of bread that had been microwaved too long. The chicken was also rubbery. All in all, it was a miserable mess that had been thrown together. Never again!  I ended up having to buy some trail mix to sustain me on a 5 hour flight.

TqRvalWBouUkKn70GECjag.text: Fine for an airport restaurant.  Nice place to sit down for a minute, if you have the time.  Service is a little lacking - seemed overwhelmed.  But the food came out quickly.  I had the Jerk Chicken Cobb Salad with the ranch dressing.  It was really good - and pretty spicy (I think that was the Ranch dressing).  I thought at first it was missing the promised guacamole - but it's under the wedges of lettuce.

_7AyUuUxve4OBbT140I2hg.text: Ordered the honey rum Shrimp bowl and it was ok at best! But the price of 15.99 plus 2 bucks for the guacamole comes to a total of 18.00 dollars. I would give the food 2 stars at best.... Drinks were a 3 or a 4 stars tho!

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

ewktMJjRF5gJ2rsX_M2Rvw.text: Dear god this place is horrific! I order wings and the came out raw the fries were cold this was after waiting 45 minutes. After no apologies or explanation and an additional 45 minutes later second order came out cooked but cold. I pray I don't get sick on my flight. AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COST!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

9QsVTx1N4c0VTyhmTjpAYw.text: Airport food.  I've been here before.  The service is iffy.  Not very friendly but efficient for the most part.  The food is ok.  Edible, filling, a bit pricey but that's airport food for you.  It's here if you want something warm.  I like the fact that I can sit here and relax for a few minutes before going to my gate.

photos.caption: Photo of Rum Bar & Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

uV0LVbdPHCHZdfJgWByfjg.text: Nachos with jerk chicken were fine,  but a smaller portion than you're used to. Good for new years resolutions I suppose.   The poor rating is for how a waitress (not mine) treated an old guy. He got a sandwich from the restaurant's take out counter,  then sat down to eat it. He left the bag on the table and started to leave. The waitress yelled at him to take the bag to a trash can on the concourse.  He said it was from her restaurant. She yelled again.  I was embarrassed for the old guy and she certainly disrupted other diners.

6cq1lAn3K9fhS6goj-PhWw.text: There are just two differences between Rum Bar & Grill and Burger King, BK has good food for the buck, and Rum Bar & Grill has a bar.  Just had the Coconut Mango Chicken Salad and one 9oz glass of Sonoma Chardonnay. My food came to just under $13 and there were more wilted greens on my plate than a field in Ireland after a really bad storm.  And for the money charged, I had the UN-pleasure of eating with deeply discounted plastic cutlery.  You know...the kind you get at an old school block party back in the 70's.    My glass of wine totaled just over $20, but at least it was delivered in a carafe.  Seriously, $20 would have bought me a bottle of Sonoma Coutre at Walmart.    I get it.  I am at the airport and business travelers tend to be less sensitive.  But...seriously???   I am giving Rum Bar & Grill two stars because my Server was on top of her game.  She was attentive, friendly and quick.  It just isn't her fault the final product sucked.    If you find yourself in terminal E at the Charlotte airport I suggest stopping to eat at the grab n go across for Rum Bar & Grill and then walking over for a beer.    I'm done!!!
